name: EDGE
description: EDGE, the award winning retro-styled platform game has been extended! Now with over 40 brand new levels, additional music and all-new races against the notorious Dark Cube!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor: Intel Pentium 4 / AMD Athlon XP 1.5 Ghz or higher Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9 compatible, 64MB VRAM DirectX®: dx90c Hard Drive: 250 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: An interesting puzzle game where you guide a cube over different obstacles to gather smaller cubes and find the exit. Your performance depends on how fast you complete the level and how many times you've died. It's equal parts challenging, mind-bending and fun.

-------------- Pro's: -------------- * The game is unique, with its own idea of the puzzle genre, using a cube to roll around and navigate a constantly changing, atmospheric world.  * The music is great, and is one of the main elements to the game that will cause you to have random nostalgiac dance sessions.  * As the price is considerably low at 7.99 US Dollars, I would reccomend to wait for a sale, as I have seen two 90% off sales within `30 days.  * Can be played as casually, or as rage enducing as you would like, with the level completion system being an A-D grading system, alongside counting the amount of fails and checkpoints you have.  *A fun 'Pick up and play' game, not having to have any knowledge or skill prior to using this game. (However, I would reccomend that you already know how to use your keyboard, eyes, and reactions.)  * Quick download, low amount of space required, and little to no set up. This encourages people to jump right into the game, without having to mess with tons of configuration files to get a smoot, nice gameplay experience  -------------- Con's: -------------- * The settings tab doesn't have very many choices in terms of render quality. (But the game isn't graphically intensive, so this is ruled out.)  * The controls are solid, but it is hard to enterperate what it will do sometimes. This is only very few amount of times, so don't let it deter you from getting this masterpiece of a puzzle game.  -------------- In Conclusion: -------------- This game is alot of fun for anyone, with interesting gameplay elements that get you engaged, without giving you a lot of stress like most puzzle games give you nowadays, as at some moments, it will get you on the EDGE... See what I did there? Anyway, I would give this Indie title a 9 out of 10, and I strongly reccomend you BUY THIS GAME AND GO PLAY IT!
Thank you Steam for giving me this game. Hunting 10+ coals wasn't completely in vain after all.  Except for that I had a major headache from this clustershit boring game.

A beautifully meticulous game that does not fail at angering you, however, you cannot really get mad. Instead of waving your fists in the air when your cube falls, gets crushed or is pushed off a ledge you smile a great smile. A curse or a gift. Split-second decisions will force you into fast-paced, 'anti-gravitational' situations which will oddly grab you and pull you in!  I bought this game while it was on sale, however, I would totally have paid the seven dollars. This game is nothing but perfect.   10/10. Would EDGE again!

Simple and addicting, what else could you want ? The puzzles are varied enough to always keep you on your toes and the soundtrack is terrific. Beware, if you plan on getting the best score in every stage, prepare to spend a lot of time ... and I mean A LOT.

Made me feel like it's over ten years ago, buying a 'new' game for my (bootleg) NES and not being able to stop playing because it's so simple and entertaining. The 8-bit feeling is not only because of the art style (I totally dig that prismatic style they gave the game!), it's got the (not 'an') appropriate soundtrack too!  Also has a demo. More games should have a demo.

EDGE is a simple game, yet difficult, 3D, singlpleyer platformer that is really fun. It reminds me of a mobile game that I used to play, but I can't rememeber what's it's called..  In EDGE, your only goal is to get to the end of each level. well, at least, that's all I can get out of this game. There are a bunch of obsticles, such as moving platforms, buttons, and even a thing that lets you turn into a miniture version of yourself. the game is simple, but the controls are a bit weird, and even tripy. I find myself playing with the controller more, to satisfy myself. Now, when I say weird, I don't mean that they're bad controls. It's the game's diagonal view-point that makes them weird, and why I use control when playing this game.  Overall, this is a decent game. It's difficult, i will say that, but it is fun. I recommend this game to people who have a good tolerance, for both difficulty and tripy things.

A fun puzzle/timing/reflex game that's very simple. It ♥♥♥♥s with your mind every now and then and it can easily be challenging.  It's boring after a while, so play that game in small dozes.  Overall: 7/10
bip bip boop soundtrack is awesome, lots of skill much increiblee

This is a great game for burning some time and having fun at the same time. It doesn't require your undivided attention so it's a nice little minigame to have running when you're not really doing anything. It has a good soundtrack, and is definitley worth the price!
I bought this game for 29 cents + Good game for that price - Trading cards 8/10
If you are looking for a game with retro / 8-bit music, this is the game for you.
i swear to god i  need  this game's soundtrack as a seperate purchase

So good. One of the best action games I've played. Requires strategy and keeps you in for hours on end with it's captivating music to it's colourful block! I recommend you get this on PC and on your Ipod, Iphone and Ipad no matter what the cost is. It also comes with 40 levels of DLC (downloadable content) completely FREE! Why haven't you got this yet??!

Bought this game for 34 cents, which is basically a steal. I can only recommend this game since it contains fun, entertainting, and mind-boggling puzzles. Simplistic but cool graphics, cute soundtrack and diverse levels.

Too plodding and slow paced to be the kind of reaction based platformer it wants to be. Edge also relies on deaths you couldn't possibly know are coming the first time through, which is just cheap. It's a shame, because in many ways the levels are very well crafted, for the most part-there's clearly a lot of thought that goes into certain aspects of the design, but the execution is sorely lacking.
cut myself on the edge

Same review for the four Two Tribes games: This is a simple puzzle well executed, but I quickly lost interest in the mechanics. Only good as a minor diversion. Worth it at 90% off, but not full price.

This is the Worst Game I've ever bought. It's a cool concept but poor execution. SAVE YOUR MONEY! I bought on sale for $0.79 and that was $0.80 too much. The controlls are the WORST. WASD is actually BETTER then controller. Cool Concept, poor execution, buy Cubot instead. It's about $2 and WAY more fun to play.
Could be more dead babies.  -Chris Ellis 2k15
THIS GAME IS AWESOME Puzzle game !!!!

Сute and totally relaxing   This game is perfect for calming down after a tough day... + Lots of levels + Achievements help you to explore the physics of this world - Music is not always pleasant, and i am speaking about the tracks themself, not about the genre.

In a world made entirely of cubes (undoubtedly the inspiration for Minecraft, I'm sure), your job as a fellow cube is to make it to the end of each of 109 different levels. Each level features three different additional goals: a survival element, a collect-a-thon element, and a time trial element. The amount of nuance put into the last aspect is what makes the game perfect for speedrunners. Not only do the collectibles, in addition to being necessary for an S+ rank, increase your speed for a short amount of time, but any extra time you'd normally incur can be negated with the use of EDGE time - that is, your cube will stick to walls and edges, and any time spent hanging there does not factor in to your final level time. This adds an additional layer of strategy and timing which is sure to have you replaying the same levels again and again.  The controls are a bit clumsy at first, but you'll become acclimated soon enough (and you can change the direction of 'up' in options). The graphics are not the best, but they at least accomplish what they're supposed to, and there's no ambiguity with what's traversable and what's not. The soundtrack is stellar, and makes it difficult to get very mad at the game. Overall, a rousing success, and as it's only eighty cents in the current sale - well, it's really a no-brainer.
I'M ON THE EDGE OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOH AND I'M NOT GONNA FALL
Amazingly addictive puzzle platformer.
Just not a very appealing game mechanic. What can I say. Expected a puzzle game, got a weird speedrun-ish kinda game...
This game awesome, you can't get bored, (until you beat the game). It is so fun, that you might play it, 24/7!!!
I like rolling cubes and collecting cubes.
Well done, but no charm.  If you're a platforming addict, I'd recommend. Otherwise, pass.

It's an ok game. Not reccommended because it's just not a captivating game. You are a cube and you roll around board after board trying to get to the end. You collect prisms along the way, although there doesn't appear to be any use in doing this unless you want the achievement. The levels get harder and harder, but getting to the end isn't really that hard. You are basically just trying to finish as quick as you can. Some of the maps are long and interesting, but alot of them are a pain. Too many levels where your cube dissappears and you have to move around and then your cube falls through the floor and you start over. Decent idea for a game, not executed as well as it could have been.  A no for me.

Very overlooked game. It's very cool and puzzling, sometimes a bit ragey, because the puzzles get VERY HARD. Not exactly easy on the eyes if you are photosensetive. Still extremely fun and challenging.

This is almost a decent game. I kind of like the 'edge' mechanic of literally hanging off the edges of things with your cube you're rolling around the maps, but it's a port and it feels like it. If it were more polished (and it weren't so much more difficult and just plain weird with a controller, which it seems like it should be more suited to than the keyboard), I'd probably kill some more time with it, but...it's not.

Do you get a boner whenever you even think about hearing SID-chip music? Have you ever fixed your ♥♥♥♥♥♥ broken ♥♥♥ 1541 by jamming your weiner in it and using your ♥♥♥♥ as a direct-applicant lubricant? Do you really love the ♥♥♥♥ out of squares? Then you'll frickin' love this really basic block-moving puzzle-platform game. On the other hand, if you don't like paying real life money for somebody's personal hobby project which was probably only created to force people to listen to some wretched SID artist's boring ♥♥♥ chiptunes, then don't buy this game.  (Rob Hubbard and Matt Gray ♥♥♥♥ing own. Whoever did the music here? Meh)
Good game. For 79 cents, NOT 7.99. It feels like the app. Not much said besides i like this adictive game.
pimp game. you're a square if you don't play this.
pretty cool but i dont play it often

NAO DIS IS A PUZZLE GAEM.  ^ Is most likely what you're thinking. But it isn't, rather... an adventure... block... game? Take the role of a cuboid and flip around levels in order to finish them in the fastest time possible without falling off the map and ensuring you get the best score. Seems easy but it ain't. The levels get pretty fast and there are hidden traps. Me likey and me thinkey it worth your money.

Its a good game. Not great, just good. I like gameplay, the retro style, and the varirity of levels. I dont like the 3D look, because it makes the controls very tedious. Its one of those types of games to play when you have nothing to do.

I have no idea why,  but...  I feel as if this game needs some kind of level editor...  Anyone else?  I mean, I get it if it shouldn't, but a level editor would be pretty awesome. ifthisquestionhasn'talreadybeenaskedmillionsoftimes
nice athestic , good gameplay , decent soundtrack . buy it its a gem
Very touching storyline and deep plot. 11/10 Worst enemy is the keys.

A cool platformer with light puzzle elements. And you just guide a cube though levels, with a hanging mechanic. But the levels are well designed for the most part. There's over 100 levels, and a lot of achievements. The music is also cool. But controling the cube is kind of hard at first, especially changing directions suddenly. And the game is both easy and hard. If you're just trying to finish the game, the game is easy, with plenty of checkpoints and no death penalties. But to get max rank and compete in the learderboards, you'll need a lot of patience. So it's a game for everyone. And a cool one.
This game is cheap and awesome. It brought me back memories when I saw this because I had this on my old phone before.
Good Game and Good Music
Game for relaxation :)
This game could do with a multiplayer. Split screen or same screen where you race other players.
this game, make me think har. if u want to win this game just folow the map
I even felt like a cube playing this game
Played through the whole game and it was an awesome experience!   Pros:

Simple and intuitive, it can challange both casual and hardcore players, for its depth, addictive gameplay and constant support by the developers. An enjoyable puzzler that does its best to get the most out of a clever and simple idea. Just a simple idea that brings forth some fun puzzles for some quick enjoyment.
A puzzle game that has a soft spot in my heart, its fun and challenging... for an indie this game is a real Gem.

Rather positive, relaxing casual game. Its main disadvantage is having some unique mechanics but not using them often enough. The best thing about it is that it's nice and pleasant to play, you don't get horribly punished for mistakes, you just respawn next to the place you failed at. It's a bit tedious and thus best played in bursts of 15-30 minutes. At some point the concept gets tired and the later levels get rather frustrating to complete. EDGE seems to have massive discounts during sales, and it's worth trying out when that it's priced at around a buck.

THIS GAME MAKES ME EDGEY........  Sorry for the bad pun. The game is probably one of the best puzzle games I own. HOWEVER YOU DO NOT WANT TO PLAY THIS GAME AFTER A LONG HARD DAY. IT IS SO ANNOYING AND SO CHALLANGING THAT YOU EVENTUALLY GET BORED. IS IT A GOOD GAME? YES IS IT WORTH THE $8? NO IS IT FUN? DEPENDS IF YOU DON'T LIKE A CHALLANGE OR PUZZLE GAMES DON'T BUY IT I GOT IT FOR LIKE 99 c DURING A SALE AND I'M HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE BUT I DON'T KNOW WETHER I'D GET IT IF IT WAS FULL PRICE. I'M GOING TO RECOMMEND IT BECAUSE I LIKE IT. BUT JUST THINK IT THROUGH BEFORE BUYING THIS GAME.

Simple, fun, beatiful and challenging. A nice addition to anyones steam library if on sale. Similar design as the game RUSH but with different gamplay mechanics.   The block movement method takes a while to get used to. I never mastered it. It felt a bit too easy to over shoot where you wanted to go. I am sure practice would mostly get rid of this problem.   I would give this game a 7/10

An abstract cubic obstacle course with an electronic score and wildly clever puzzles, EDGE is nothing if not unique. There's no story (although you can make one up as you get further into certain levels), and no goal other than getting from point A to point B. You can move and Edge hang along walls, and that's about it. This simplicity is stretched to an unfathomable length by creative puzzles and obstacles to navigate, forcing you to think in multiple dimensions. It's complex enough to provide a challenge, but minimal enough so that virtually any player can get into it. Most levels have their own charm to them, and got more than a laugh or two out of me. The electronic music is vast, varied, and catchy. The controls aren't too precise, however; you rarely ever feel like you have control of the cube unless you find that 'sweet spot' with the arrow keys, Plus, the isometric perspective doesn't help. Despite this, the game rarely gets frustrating, and death is more a learning experience than a punishment. Despite the touchy controls and a stale art style, EDGE is an addictive and clever obstacle course that is more than worth your cash,
Something you could see on a C64. And that is a high praise. Retro simplicity in just the right way.

It's more or less really just a dumb iPhone game, with lazy yet attactive visuals and a simple mechanic elaborated upon to some satisfactory extent over the course of way too many much too short levels. The one-room stages really cheapen the experience, there's no sense that you're going anywhere that matters. The music is not very good at reminding you that you're playing a video game. This game is really too easy, there is no punishment for death and surviving yeilds no sense of accomplishment. It's like most indie games, it will let you commit cube suicide 56 times in a row without making you repeat any content. The gameplay is fun but the experience is mediocre. Out of the near-limitless selection of bargain bin iPhone conversion shovelware with sparse, me-too indie graphics, this is the cream of the crop, and I mean that. Certainly buy this metered, bite-sized gamelike experience on sale for 1-3 dollars. Just don't expect an epic journey.
I love this Game. Simple but addictive Game. I bought it in one of the many famous Sales. But it is every penny worth.  Everyone who love puzzle games with a little twist should buy it.
Really fun and interesting puzzle game that is challenging enough to keep you on your toes but forgiving with plenty of checkpoints. Highly recommended if you like puzzle platform-type games.
An awesome platformer with it's own little secrets and tons of levels to play! It's a relatively simple game, and gets challenging as you progress.

The controls and general movement physics are certainly not without their share of glitches, but once you get used to handling your little cubic protagonist, you'll find a simplistic world filled with level design that is equal parts cute and clever.
wierd controlls. trippy
I think this is an awesome indie game. If you like doing puzzle games this is perfect for you
Convenient death traps: The Game.

EDGE is a fun little isometric platformer that somewhat reminds me of the old Playstation gem, Kula World (Google it!). The difficulty is fair and justified. Levels have no time limit, you have infinite lives, there are little hint nodes that introduce you to the more obscure mechanics and there are mini checkpoints before the more tricky sections. My only real criticism is that small precise movements can sometimes be a pain because of the way your block tends to teeter on it's side.
Great arcade with nice gameplay and soundtrack. Very stylish.

This is a wonderful terrible game. It starts out kind and happy and fun. Then it decides that you're a terrible person and it starts finding new ways to tell you that it hates you. It's the abusive boyfriend of video games.

Most minimalist game money can buy; you are a cube, You goal is to make it to the warp zone at the end, simple! Except for the constantly altering platforms, 3 dimensional negotiation of narrow tricky edges, collectibles, and a time limit. The best part by far though is the inclusion of full XBox 360 controller support, no 3rd party controller software here!
Really nice puzzle game with an awesome soundtrack to go with it :3

I have never in my whole life sworn at a game as much as I have at this game. The controls infuriate me beyond belief. I've read some of the other negative comments, but I have played isometric puzzlers since Ant Attack on the ZX81 and Marble Madness on the AtariST. It's not the NW/NE/SW/SE thing that really irritates me (as it does others), it's the way the controls REACT DIFFERENTLY BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF STUFF ON THE SCREEN!!!  You're a cube, and unlike most cube games where you ROLL along nicely, in this game, there's inertia and proper physics. Have you ever tried to ROLL a cube? It's about as much fun as shaving your privates. It's why the square wheel never really took off.   The Physics engine is tied to the frame rate, so when there's less on the screen, the cube reacts a lot faster to your controls, and falls back at a different rate too. So a light tap on the up key in one part of a level might allow you to lift yourself gently and get some 'edge time', while at another, it'll flip you boldy completely over two tiles and into the chasm.    The name, and the point of the game are to 'hang' on your 'edges', but hanging on edges is so flipping HARD with keys. I've worn a little gap in the surface of my down arrow repeatedly trying to get the 60 second edge-time achievement (bloody hard).   So, What do I think about the game? It's music and aesthetics are okay.. The controls are clunky, variable, and highly annoying. The level design is interesting and sometimes actually fun.  Would I recommend this game? If you haven't played Rush yet, yes. If you've already played Rush, then this will be more of the same, with a much more irritating control system. The only thing which really makes this stand out are the mobile levels which 'morph' on the click of a button. That was fun.. But the 'click a button, then dodge a piece of flying platform' mechanic gets old.   Yes, if this game is a few quid, get it, play it, then move on. I'd give it a 'Meh' out of 10.   ADVICE: Play this game on a high-end PC and frame limit it to 60fps. Then the controls will at least be uniform across the game.
Here it is the awsome and addictive retro style platformer stuff.
Nice and cheap
Wow!  It's fun like a rollercoaster.  It's no 10/10 but buy the two tribes pack, it's on sale a bunch and worth it even when it's not.

What I liked:      Nice soundtrack     Good art style     Simple yet fun platforming   What You Need to Know:      The game is mostly easy with some parts that are hard     Has lots of acheivements to challenge you     Controls can be hard to used too ( I always go one to far and fall off, hard to be precise at least with keyboard for me )    My Score:

The techno-chiptune music is great The cuboid visuals are great and work with the gameplay The controls are from an isometric perspective, but still good You have an evil, grey cube nemesis You ride block-robots There are tiny rainbow cubes YOU TURN INTO A TINY CUBE The dificulty curve is fair and it's less than $10  Yes, yes, and yes.
Starts off a bit slow, but finished as a modern compliment to Marble Madness.
Are you ready to put your fingers and your concentration tested, well, in this simple but addictive game you found this great challenge.  10 / 10
A tricky game in great design that call for you areal imagination.

Excellent Game,with fine art-style and graphics. Very colorful and challenging levels,which make you think twice before taking an action...  Overall I would give it a 9/10,could use some improvements UI wise,but it is truly fun!

One of my all time favorite games. Puzzles aren't too punishing in the begining and the difficulty level rises just right. Reminds me of ZX Spectrum games, Chips Challenge and even Sonic 3D(but S3D is the worst example). Music tends to be real good but there are a few songs that have a bit nervous soundtrack. Worth the money!
its pretty neat
In future, im waiting for co-op!

You control a cube in this game, which is a bit of slippery because of the physics Not my cup of tea, but I kinda enjoy it Some of you may like it  Overall presentation is good Level design is okay, not that interesting but not boring either Music and sounds are good, suits the gameplay

I mostly played EDGE on my phone (humble bundles rule!) but I figured I could give it at least 5 minutes of steam play to write this review. Edge is not a platformer. Edge is its own genre, too smart for a platformer and too quick and reactive for a puzzler. I really respect this game because of the intelligence and detail that goes into every level. With all that being said, I preferred the experience on a phone. The short, bite-sized level format works very well on mobile. I'm giving the game a 'recommend' because it is good, but you should consider getting it for your phone instead of your PC.
SHORT REVIEW: One of my favourite pick up and play games: It's simple, fun and addicting. Nothing more nithing less. Go get it!
creative game, genius game, serious game, rage game, i like it

In general, many people don't expect too much from these cheap games, but this one... It's totally worth every penny. Different from many others, It's not even necessary 'to learn' how to play. It's really simple. Graphics are great, sound effects and music are good (it matches well with the atmosphere of the game) and the interface is clean.

when i was child i had this game at my old Nokia. when i play this game i feel some strong feeling of nostalgia. this game makes me sad and happy in one time. i like this game not for graphic, sounds or gameplay - no! i like this game for memories which it gives me... 10/10
